intro: Jacquinia berteroi var. acutifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaved jacquinia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Ericaceae family, which includes heathers and blueberries, and is characterized by its evergreen shrub form. The plant features small, needle-like leaves that are typically dark green and glossy, and it produces clusters of white or pale pink bell-shaped flowers in late spring. It thrives in well-drained, acidic soils and is often found in rocky or woodland habitats. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and natural areas.
